FuncDef:
The radius-attribute framed-route netmask-limit low command configures the minimum mask length for the Framed-Route attribute.
The undo radius-attribute framed-route netmask-limit low command restores the default configuration.
By default, the minimum mask length of the Framed-Route attribute (No. 22 RADIUS attribute) is 0, indicating that the device can parse the Framed-Route attribute with any mask length.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a mask length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The RADIUS server delivers the Framed-route attribute in authentication response packets. If the mask length of the Framed-Route attribute delivered in the authentication response packets is less than the configured mask length, the device considers the attribute delivered by the RADIUS server invalid and does not parse the attribute. In this case, users go online normally.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
